Job Title: Data Scientist | Cleantech SAAS Platform | Remote Working
Job Description:
$90,000 - $110,000 + Equity
Work for a company that's making a difference for the environment
Remote working

The Company:

This exciting start-up is an innovative cleantech company, bringing energy reducing technology solutions to consumers, trade, utilities, and government to help create a more sustainable future. They are building a dynamic enterprise software-as-a-service platform and are looking for people with a passion, curiosity, and purpose for using their skills and creativity to make the world a better place. They are a provider of data services, applications and intelligence to governments and utilities in the areas of energy efficiency and renewable energy. They’ve developed a data framework that provides continuous data optimization of energy efficiency data using proprietary algorithms that power white-label applications and or hosted services for energy efficiency programs. Their applications include an opportunity map for energy intensity, digital building audit tools, engagement tools and an online marketplace.




We are looking for a data scientist that will help discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help this company make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, understanding GIS and geo-spatial mapping and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products. Specifically, you will automate their building energy scoring using machine learning techniques, build recommendation systems, and further develop their catalog of products for energy efficiency and renewable building improvements.
The ideal candidate will have a passion for putting analytical data skills towards solving complex problems with a focus on geo-spatial techniques, working well with teams, and fighting hard to meet deadlines and build break-out products.




If you’re looking for an opportunity to join a cutting-edge start-up, working on some of the most exciting applications and technology in the business, don’t hesitate in putting forward an application! To automatically receive notifications upon new roles and market updates, follow our LinkedIn page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/white-bay-search/

Job#: 1291646

Job Description:
Data Scientist

Apex Systems is a global IT services provider, and our staffing group has an opening for an Data Scientist to place at our client, an Enterprise Retail Company.

Client: Enterprise Retail Company

Start date: ASAP

Terms: 6-month contract to start – possibility of extension/conversion

40 hours p/week

Currently Remote; office in North York for purposeful meetings

Please submit your resume via the platform you are using. If you encounter any issues, please email your resume to Rohan at rkapur@apexsystems.com and reference Data Scientist.

Job Description

Data Scientist

We are seeking world-class talent looking to build a career with the world’s largest improvement retailer, operating more than 2,200 store locations in the U.S, Canada and Mexico. Specifically, your role in our clients will place you at the center of one of the top retailers in Canada that is experiencing an exciting growth trajectory.

You will work with IT teams and business partners to understand strategic initiatives as well as support the delivery of leading-edge capabilities that support our clients retail business.

The Data Scientist will be responsible for partnering with key business stakeholders and leveraging internal clients and industry data to develop predictive algorithms and models. The primary focus of the Sr. Data scientist will be to identify trends in data to glean meaningful business insights and drive cross-functional business solutions via statistical data analysis, and advanced analytics techniques in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML). The individual will also work closely with other IT Product teams and support the various stages of the analytics development lifecycle. A successful candidate will be passionate about seeing real-world impact of advanced analytics and have a solid understanding of scientific and business needs, as well as the areas of data science, AI and ML that can be transformative and impactful to the retail industry.


Leverage strong communication skills and business acumen to work closely with cross-functional business owners to drive data and analytics technologies for business use.
To design, develop and implement predictive/analytical algorithms and statistical data modeling tools to derive insights for complex business operations and processes.
Be a subject matter expert in supervised and unsupervised ML algorithms and other applied AI techniques to derive meaningful and actionable insights from big data.
Implement scalable, efficient processes for large scale data analyses, model development and deployment.
Be responsible for effectively communicating insights, findings, test results, performance analysis to both functional teams, and the senior management along with recommendations for enhancements/improvements.
Continually drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. Constantly upskill and remain fully updated with the evolving data and analytics community.
Provides technical advice, support and guidance to junior data scientists and ML engineers on navigating ML/AI modeling work for real-world business problems on a case-by-case basis.


Master’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or Mathematics (or Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science, Math or related quantitative field).
4 to 6 years of experience in data science, data mining, analysis, and visualization with the ability to identify and present actionable insights from data to address business problems (preferably in the retail sector).
Have a good understanding of data analysis, advanced analytics with exposure to AI/ML and technologies within the cloud environment.
Demonstrated experience in using statistical and data manipulation languages (e.g. Python, R, SQL) and familiarity with Confluence, and JIRA.
Strong communication, presentation and documentation skills is also required.

What do we offer?

An opportunity to gain real-world experience in supporting data science and analytics initiatives within a large retail organization.
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional growth and development.
A unique and competitive team, an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages thinking “outside-the-box”, being inquisitive to learning, and sharing success.
An attractive compensation and benefits package.

EEO Employer

Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystems.com or 844-463-6178.

Machine Learning Engineering Intern
Who We Are
Nanode Battery Technologies (http://www.nanodetech.com/) is a start-up company that designs and produces high performance materials for the next generation of lithium ion batteries. Our vision is to electrify the future with nanotechnology. Nanode is a vibrant, energetic, fast-growing start-up. We believe that battery technology is one of the keys to a better future for us all, by reducing our reliance on fossil fuels, and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
The Role
The Machine Learning (ML) Engineering Intern will help to develop a software platform to improve the efficiency of battery R&D. This internal tool augments the experience and insights of chemists by identifying the most promising formulations and processing parameters for Nanode’s next generation battery technology. The ML Engineering Intern will be responsible for developing machine learning models and optimization tools as well as building a combination of processes and technology that will allow the tool to be effectively used by Nanode’s team.

Position
Applied Data Scientist
Reporting to
Director of Technology
About the role
Airudi is looking for an applied data scientist to discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and to build the AI models that will enable Human Resources professionals to make smarter decisions.
Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our cloud native solutions.

Company details:
Rocket Science provides end-to-end machine-learning strategy, development, and deployment expertise.
Our Rocket Data Scientists or “Datastronauts”, have in-depth experience and a proven track record with leveraging AI & ML solutions to explore complex business problems, build exciting models, and create real value.
Operating and launching from our HQ in Montreal, Canada. We are growing rapidly due to the huge success we are bringing to our clients.
What You’ll Do:
- Build machine learning models using Python

Level AI is a Mountain View, CA-based startup innovating in the Voice AI space. We are backed by top VCs, technologists from Silicon Valley and industry experts. We are on a mission to revolutionize the customer sales experience for businesses. We are innovating in speech AI, NLP and information retrieval systems to bring customers and businesses closer to one another. As one of the critical members of the Level team your work will be new and of the highest impact to shape the future of AI in businesses. You will directly work with a team of experienced technologists to identify and solve a new set of problems. The team has experience from Amazon Alexa, Google, and other leading AI organizations. You will have the freedom to pave a new path to achieve our mission.
Responsibilities
Big picture: Understand customers’ needs and innovate and use cutting edge Machine Learning techniques to build data-driven solutions.
Work on NLP problems across areas such as text classification, entity extraction, summarization and others.

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

Job Title: Data Science Intern for fast-growing startup
Job Description:
Company description
10Adventures is a fast-growing tech company focused on Adventure Travel. Our Adventure Travel Ecosystem lets outdoor lovers plan their next adventure - whether they want to use our free, guidebook quality info to plan their trip or book a tour on a marketplace that connects them to local tour operators in over 75 countries.
Job description
The Data Scientist Intern role will be focused on solving real world business challenges for a fast-growing tech company. The main goal will be to use data to optimize our business performance, with a particular emphasis on advanced analytics to improve user experience and drive increased sales.
The successful candidate will rely on a strong background and love for predictive modeling, forecasting, statistics, and optimization. They will use these skills to deliver solutions and recommendations that the business can rely on for decisions that could have multi-million dollar impacts.

Job Title: Data Scientist, Data, Analytics, Evaluation and Reporting (DARE)
Job Description:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.

In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA. As such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.

Reporting to a Director, Data Analytics Reporting and Evaluation (DARE), the Data Scientist develops, operationalizes and improves analytical models to support and inform operational, tactical and strategic decision making at PHSA. The Data Scientist is adept at using large data sets to build Operations Research models to find opportunities for service delivery and process optimization, as well as to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Employs a variety of modeling and data analysis techniques, and utilizes knowledge of the operations and care delivery to build realistic models. The Data Scientist drives business results with evidence-based insights and works with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The Data Scientist discovers solutions hidden in large data sets and works with stakeholders to improve business processes and outcomes.

Do you want to help local businesses grow? Our Ad Targeting team connects millions of users to the right businesses each day. From restaurants, boutiques, and salons, to dentists, mechanics, and plumbers, our recommendation system knows just the place.

As an Applied Scientist, you will design robust A/B experiments to characterize user behavior, assess machine learning models through careful statistical analysis, and build end-to-end machine learning models that help millions of users make better decisions.

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we’re a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages creative solutions to problems. We enable all new team members to deploy working code in their first week, and your impact will only grow from there with the support of your manager, mentor, and team. Learn more about Yelp by visiting: Culture at Yelp / Yelp Fact Sheet / Diversity at Yelp / Yelp Engineering Blog / Yelp Blog / Yelp Open Source / Yelp Economic Average.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Aviva Canada Returners Program – Data Science
Location: Ontario, Canada (Markham/Toronto/Oakville)
Opportunity: 6-month returnship, with online Launch Event
Start Date: January 2023
Apply by: 31 October 2022 for Program, register by 12 October for Launch Event
Individually we are people, but together we are Aviva. Individually these are just words, but together they are our Values – Care, Commitment, Community, and Confidence.
If you’re ready to return to work after a career break and actively looking for your next challenge, then the Aviva Canada Returner Program could be the answer. The Aviva Canada Returner Program is for those who’ve had an extended career break of one or more years. This is a tailored six-month program starting in January 2023, potentially transitioning to a permanent role for those keen to restart their career.
Roles will be based across Aviva’s key locations in Ontario: Markham, Oakville, and Downtown Toronto.

Position Title: Data Scientist
Position Type: Regular - Full-Time
Position Location: Florenceville GTC
Grade: Grade 04
Requisition ID: 18048

We know the importance that food plays in people's lives – the power it has to bring people, families and communities together. Our purpose is to bring enjoyment to people’s lives through great tasting food, in a way which reflects our values.


Earth Observation at McCain operates as a new, independent start-up division under McCain Foods Limited. Through the use of satellite and other remote sensing technologies, the business unit delivers crop insights to McCain agriculture, farmers, and other non-competitive crop buyers to improve decision-making on crop production and agricultural practices under climate volatility.

Introduction
As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

IBM's state-of-the-art Client Innovation Centre (CIC) opened in Nova Scotia in March 2013 and is the first of its kind in Canada. The Centre weaves together IBM’s business insights and industry-leading software portfolio and is ideally suited for any client that needs flexible access to emerging or niche skills that may not be cost effective to grow internally. In addition, our focus on our team is unparalleled as demonstrated by the following:

We are looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.
Responsibilities
Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms

Company Description

You will join a world-class team of engineers and data scientists from Facebook, Uber, Amazon and Google. We are a fast growing consulting firm based in Toronto with clients ranging from leading startups building impactful technologies to Fortune 500 companies looking to scale their engineering and data capabilities.

Job Description

We are looking for Data Scientists who are passionate about Machine Learning, and have deep knowledge in Statistics and Computer Science. You enjoy doing data science projects with structured and/or unstructured data and are motivated to productize scalable machine learning models. We will also rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for this role.

Data Scientist

At Drax we are working towards a zero-carbon, sustainable future and you can help make this future a reality.
If you are a strong communicator who is strategic, technical and who values quality, then the Data Scientist position maybe your next best move.

So, what will you be doing?

You will further the knowledge base of Drax Group with exploratory and iterative data science programmes.

At Desjardins, we believe in equity, diversity and inclusion. We're committed to welcoming, respecting and valuing people for who they are as individuals, learning from their differences, embracing their uniqueness, and providing a positive workplace for all. At Desjardins, we have zero tolerance for discrimination of any kind. We believe our teams should reflect the diversity of the members, clients and communities we serve.
If there's something we can do to help make the recruitment process or the job you're applying for more accessible, let us know. We can provide accommodations at any stage in the recruitment process. Just ask!
Being a data scientist at Desjardins means having the drive to develop a passion for data models, machine learning concepts and quantitative fields (mathematics, finance, actuarial science, statistics, etc.).
We develop and train a wide variety of predictive and prescriptive models so we can do what's best for our members and clients.
Thanks to the models developed to measure the impact of interest rates and inflation, and even various analyses like spatial analyses, we can measure the natural disaster risks that our members and clients could face. Other initiatives focus on risk quantification and customer loyalty models.
The data scientist teams at Desjardins play a strategic role in the organization.

Job Title: Data Scientist | Cleantech SAAS Platform | Remote Working
Job Description:
$90,000 - $110,000 + Equity
Work for a company that's making a difference for the environment
Remote working

The Company:

This exciting start-up is an innovative cleantech company, bringing energy reducing technology solutions to consumers, trade, utilities, and government to help create a more sustainable future. They are building a dynamic enterprise software-as-a-service platform and are looking for people with a passion, curiosity, and purpose for using their skills and creativity to make the world a better place. They are a provider of data services, applications and intelligence to governments and utilities in the areas of energy efficiency and renewable energy. They’ve developed a data framework that provides continuous data optimization of energy efficiency data using proprietary algorithms that power white-label applications and or hosted services for energy efficiency programs. Their applications include an opportunity map for energy intensity, digital building audit tools, engagement tools and an online marketplace.




We are looking for a data scientist that will help discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help this company make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, understanding GIS and geo-spatial mapping and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products. Specifically, you will automate their building energy scoring using machine learning techniques, build recommendation systems, and further develop their catalog of products for energy efficiency and renewable building improvements.
The ideal candidate will have a passion for putting analytical data skills towards solving complex problems with a focus on geo-spatial techniques, working well with teams, and fighting hard to meet deadlines and build break-out products.




If you’re looking for an opportunity to join a cutting-edge start-up, working on some of the most exciting applications and technology in the business, don’t hesitate in putting forward an application! Job Description:
Data Scientist

Apex Systems is a global IT services provider, and our staffing group has an opening for an Data Scientist to place at our client, an Enterprise Retail Company.

Client: Enterprise Retail Company

Start date: ASAP

Terms: 6-month contract to start – possibility of extension/conversion

40 hours p/week

Currently Remote; office in North York for purposeful meetings

Please submit your resume via the platform you are using. If you encounter any issues, please email your resume to Rohan at rkapur@apexsystems.com and reference Data Scientist.

Job Description

Data Scientist

We are seeking world-class talent looking to build a career with the world’s largest improvement retailer, operating more than 2,200 store locations in the U.S, Canada and Mexico. Specifically, your role in our clients will place you at the center of one of the top retailers in Canada that is experiencing an exciting growth trajectory.

You will work with IT teams and business partners to understand strategic initiatives as well as support the delivery of leading-edge capabilities that support our clients retail business.

The Data Scientist will be responsible for partnering with key business stakeholders and leveraging internal clients and industry data to develop predictive algorithms and models. The primary focus of the Sr. Data scientist will be to identify trends in data to glean meaningful business insights and drive cross-functional business solutions via statistical data analysis, and advanced analytics techniques in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML). The individual will also work closely with other IT Product teams and support the various stages of the analytics development lifecycle. A successful candidate will be passionate about seeing real-world impact of advanced analytics and have a solid understanding of scientific and business needs, as well as the areas of data science, AI and ML that can be transformative and impactful to the retail industry.


Leverage strong communication skills and business acumen to work closely with cross-functional business owners to drive data and analytics technologies for business use.
To design, develop and implement predictive/analytical algorithms and statistical data modeling tools to derive insights for complex business operations and processes.
Be a subject matter expert in supervised and unsupervised ML algorithms and other applied AI techniques to derive meaningful and actionable insights from big data.
Implement scalable, efficient processes for large scale data analyses, model development and deployment.
Be responsible for effectively communicating insights, findings, test results, performance analysis to both functional teams, and the senior management along with recommendations for enhancements/improvements.
Continually drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. Constantly upskill and remain fully updated with the evolving data and analytics community.
Provides technical advice, support and guidance to junior data scientists and ML engineers on navigating ML/AI modeling work for real-world business problems on a case-by-case basis.


Master’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or Mathematics (or Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science, Math or related quantitative field).
4 to 6 years of experience in data science, data mining, analysis, and visualization with the ability to identify and present actionable insights from data to address business problems (preferably in the retail sector).
Have a good understanding of data analysis, advanced analytics with exposure to AI/ML and technologies within the cloud environment.
Demonstrated experience in using statistical and data manipulation languages (e.g. Python, R, SQL) and familiarity with Confluence, and JIRA.
Strong communication, presentation and documentation skills is also required.

What do we offer?

An opportunity to gain real-world experience in supporting data science and analytics initiatives within a large retail organization.
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional growth and development.
A unique and competitive team, an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages thinking “outside-the-box”, being inquisitive to learning, and sharing success.
An attractive compensation and benefits package.

EEO Employer

Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystems.com or 844-463-6178.

Machine Learning Engineering Intern
Who We Are
Nanode Battery Technologies (http://www.nanodetech.com/) is a start-up company that designs and produces high performance materials for the next generation of lithium ion batteries. Our vision is to electrify the future with nanotechnology. Nanode is a vibrant, energetic, fast-growing start-up. We believe that battery technology is one of the keys to a better future for us all, by reducing our reliance on fossil fuels, and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
The Role
The Machine Learning (ML) Engineering Intern will help to develop a software platform to improve the efficiency of battery R&D. This internal tool augments the experience and insights of chemists by identifying the most promising formulations and processing parameters for Nanode’s next generation battery technology. The ML Engineering Intern will be responsible for developing machine learning models and optimization tools as well as building a combination of processes and technology that will allow the tool to be effectively used by Nanode’s team.

Let the data do the talking! If you love a challenge and love Data, this role is for you.

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

The Data Operations and Analytics team is an internally focused reporting and analytics product minded team within TELUS, responsible for reporting on key operational metrics to ensure we are delivering to our customers. We discover key insights into our outages and provide the day to day on our ability to deliver. The Reliability Center of Excellence mission is to aim for the highest degree of service reliability for our customers – and for our team. We are dedicated to support all aspects of improving reliability here within TELUS operations. Job Title: Data Science Intern for fast-growing startup
Job Description:
Company description
10Adventures is a fast-growing tech company focused on Adventure Travel. Our Adventure Travel Ecosystem lets outdoor lovers plan their next adventure - whether they want to use our free, guidebook quality info to plan their trip or book a tour on a marketplace that connects them to local tour operators in over 75 countries.
Job description
The Data Scientist Intern role will be focused on solving real world business challenges for a fast-growing tech company. The main goal will be to use data to optimize our business performance, with a particular emphasis on advanced analytics to improve user experience and drive increased sales.
The successful candidate will rely on a strong background and love for predictive modeling, forecasting, statistics, and optimization. They will use these skills to deliver solutions and recommendations that the business can rely on for decisions that could have multi-million dollar impacts.

Level AI is a Mountain View, CA-based startup innovating in the Voice AI space. We are backed by top VCs, technologists from Silicon Valley and industry experts. We are on a mission to revolutionize the customer sales experience for businesses. We are innovating in speech AI, NLP and information retrieval systems to bring customers and businesses closer to one another. As one of the critical members of the Level team your work will be new and of the highest impact to shape the future of AI in businesses. You will directly work with a team of experienced technologists to identify and solve a new set of problems. The team has experience from Amazon Alexa, Google, and other leading AI organizations. You will have the freedom to pave a new path to achieve our mission.
Responsibilities
Big picture: Understand customers’ needs and innovate and use cutting edge Machine Learning techniques to build data-driven solutions.
Work on NLP problems across areas such as text classification, entity extraction, summarization and others.

Do you want to help local businesses grow? Our Ad Targeting team connects millions of users to the right businesses each day. From restaurants, boutiques, and salons, to dentists, mechanics, and plumbers, our recommendation system knows just the place.

As an Applied Scientist, you will design robust A/B experiments to characterize user behavior, assess machine learning models through careful statistical analysis, and build end-to-end machine learning models that help millions of users make better decisions.

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we’re a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages creative solutions to problems. We enable all new team members to deploy working code in their first week, and your impact will only grow from there with the support of your manager, mentor, and team. Learn more about Yelp by visiting: Culture at Yelp / Yelp Fact Sheet / Diversity at Yelp / Yelp Engineering Blog / Yelp Blog / Yelp Open Source / Yelp Economic Average.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Job Title: Data Scientist, Data, Analytics, Evaluation and Reporting (DARE)
Job Description:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.

In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA. As such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.

Reporting to a Director, Data Analytics Reporting and Evaluation (DARE), the Data Scientist develops, operationalizes and improves analytical models to support and inform operational, tactical and strategic decision making at PHSA. The Data Scientist is adept at using large data sets to build Operations Research models to find opportunities for service delivery and process optimization, as well as to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Employs a variety of modeling and data analysis techniques, and utilizes knowledge of the operations and care delivery to build realistic models. The Data Scientist drives business results with evidence-based insights and works with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The Data Scientist discovers solutions hidden in large data sets and works with stakeholders to improve business processes and outcomes.

Location: Ontario, Canada (Markham/Toronto/Oakville)

Start Date: January 2023
Apply by: 31 October 2022 for Program, register by 12 October for Launch Event
Individually we are people, but together we are Aviva. Individually these are just words, but together they are our Values – Care, Commitment, Community, and Confidence.
If you’re ready to return to work after a career break and actively looking for your next challenge, then the Aviva Canada Returner Program could be the answer. The Aviva Canada Returner Program is for those who’ve had an extended career break of one or more years. This is a tailored six-month program starting in January 2023, potentially transitioning to a permanent role for those keen to restart their career.
Roles will be based across Aviva’s key locations in Ontario: Markham, Oakville, and Downtown Toronto.
Aviva flexes hours and working patterns to suit its customers, business, and you. Most people are working in a hybrid fashion – spending some of their time in the offices and some at home.

Position Title: Data Scientist
Position Type: Regular - Full-Time
Position Location: Florenceville GTC
Grade: Grade 04
Requisition ID: 18048

We know the importance that food plays in people's lives – the power it has to bring people, families and communities together. Our purpose is to bring enjoyment to people’s lives through great tasting food, in a way which reflects our values.


Earth Observation at McCain operates as a new, independent start-up division under McCain Foods Limited. Through the use of satellite and other remote sensing technologies, the business unit delivers crop insights to McCain agriculture, farmers, and other non-competitive crop buyers to improve decision-making on crop production and agricultural practices under climate volatility.

Introduction
As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

IBM's state-of-the-art Client Innovation Centre (CIC) opened in Nova Scotia in March 2013 and is the first of its kind in Canada. The Centre weaves together IBM’s business insights and industry-leading software portfolio and is ideally suited for any client that needs flexible access to emerging or niche skills that may not be cost effective to grow internally. In addition, our focus on our team is unparalleled as demonstrated by the following:

We are looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.
Responsibilities
Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms

Company Description

You will join a world-class team of engineers and data scientists from Facebook, Uber, Amazon and Google. We are a fast growing consulting firm based in Toronto with clients ranging from leading startups building impactful technologies to Fortune 500 companies looking to scale their engineering and data capabilities.

Job Description

We are looking for Data Scientists who are passionate about Machine Learning, and have deep knowledge in Statistics and Computer Science. You enjoy doing data science projects with structured and/or unstructured data and are motivated to productize scalable machine learning models. We will also rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for this role.

We are looking for Data Scientists who are passionate about analytics and using data to help drive business decisions. Data Scientist

At Drax we are working towards a zero-carbon, sustainable future and you can help make this future a reality.
If you are a strong communicator who is strategic, technical and who values quality, then the Data Scientist position maybe your next best move.

So, what will you be doing?

You will further the knowledge base of Drax Group with exploratory and iterative data science programmes.

At Desjardins, we believe in equity, diversity and inclusion. We're committed to welcoming, respecting and valuing people for who they are as individuals, learning from their differences, embracing their uniqueness, and providing a positive workplace for all. At Desjardins, we have zero tolerance for discrimination of any kind. We believe our teams should reflect the diversity of the members, clients and communities we serve.
If there's something we can do to help make the recruitment process or the job you're applying for more accessible, let us know. We can provide accommodations at any stage in the recruitment process. Just ask!
Being a data scientist at Desjardins means having the drive to develop a passion for data models, machine learning concepts and quantitative fields (mathematics, finance, actuarial science, statistics, etc.).
We develop and train a wide variety of predictive and prescriptive models so we can do what's best for our members and clients.
Thanks to the models developed to measure the impact of interest rates and inflation, and even various analyses like spatial analyses, we can measure the natural disaster risks that our members and clients could face. Other initiatives focus on risk quantification and customer loyalty models.
The data scientist teams at Desjardins play a strategic role in the organization.

Be responsible for effectively communicating insights, findings, test results, performance analysis to both functional teams, and the senior management along with recommendations for enhancements/improvements.
Continually drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. Constantly upskill and remain fully updated with the evolving data and analytics community.
Provides technical advice, support and guidance to junior data scientists and ML engineers on navigating ML/AI modeling work for real-world business problems on a case-by-case basis.


Master’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or Mathematics (or Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science, Math or related quantitative field).
4 to 6 years of experience in data science, data mining, analysis, and visualization with the ability to identify and present actionable insights from data to address business problems (preferably in the retail sector).
Have a good understanding of data analysis, advanced analytics with exposure to AI/ML and technologies within the cloud environment.
Demonstrated experience in using statistical and data manipulation languages (e.g. Python, R, SQL) and familiarity with Confluence, and JIRA.
Strong communication, presentation and documentation skills is also required.

What do we offer?

An opportunity to gain real-world experience in supporting data science and analytics initiatives within a large retail organization.
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional growth and development.
A unique and competitive team, an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages thinking “outside-the-box”, being inquisitive to learning, and sharing success.
An attractive compensation and benefits package.

We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Let the data do the talking! If you love a challenge and love Data, this role is for you.

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

The Data Operations and Analytics team is an internally focused reporting and analytics product minded team within TELUS, responsible for reporting on key operational metrics to ensure we are delivering to our customers. We discover key insights into our outages and provide the day to day on our ability to deliver. The Reliability Center of Excellence mission is to aim for the highest degree of service reliability for our customers – and for our team. We are dedicated to support all aspects of improving reliability here within TELUS operations. Our team includes a passionate group of business analysts, network analysts, data analysts, data scientists and data engineers.

Job Title: Data Science Intern for fast-growing startup
Job Description:
Company description
10Adventures is a fast-growing tech company focused on Adventure Travel. Our Adventure Travel Ecosystem lets outdoor lovers plan their next adventure - whether they want to use our free, guidebook quality info to plan their trip or book a tour on a marketplace that connects them to local tour operators in over 75 countries.
Job description
The Data Scientist Intern role will be focused on solving real world business challenges for a fast-growing tech company. The main goal will be to use data to optimize our business performance, with a particular emphasis on advanced analytics to improve user experience and drive increased sales.
The successful candidate will rely on a strong background and love for predictive modeling, forecasting, statistics, and optimization. They will use these skills to deliver solutions and recommendations that the business can rely on for decisions that could have multi-million dollar impacts.

Level AI is a Mountain View, CA-based startup innovating in the Voice AI space. We are backed by top VCs, technologists from Silicon Valley and industry experts. We are on a mission to revolutionize the customer sales experience for businesses. We are innovating in speech AI, NLP and information retrieval systems to bring customers and businesses closer to one another. As one of the critical members of the Level team your work will be new and of the highest impact to shape the future of AI in businesses. You will directly work with a team of experienced technologists to identify and solve a new set of problems. The team has experience from Amazon Alexa, Google, and other leading AI organizations. You will have the freedom to pave a new path to achieve our mission.
Responsibilities
Big picture: Understand customers’ needs and innovate and use cutting edge Machine Learning techniques to build data-driven solutions.
Work on NLP problems across areas such as text classification, entity extraction, summarization and others.

Do you want to help local businesses grow? Our Ad Targeting team connects millions of users to the right businesses each day. From restaurants, boutiques, and salons, to dentists, mechanics, and plumbers, our recommendation system knows just the place.

As an Applied Scientist, you will design robust A/B experiments to characterize user behavior, assess machine learning models through careful statistical analysis, and build end-to-end machine learning models that help millions of users make better decisions.

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we’re a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages creative solutions to problems. We enable all new team members to deploy working code in their first week, and your impact will only grow from there with the support of your manager, mentor, and team. Learn more about Yelp by visiting: Culture at Yelp / Yelp Fact Sheet / Diversity at Yelp / Yelp Engineering Blog / Yelp Blog / Yelp Open Source / Yelp Economic Average.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Job Title: Data Scientist, Data, Analytics, Evaluation and Reporting (DARE)
Job Description:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.

In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA. As such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.

Reporting to a Director, Data Analytics Reporting and Evaluation (DARE), the Data Scientist develops, operationalizes and improves analytical models to support and inform operational, tactical and strategic decision making at PHSA. The Data Scientist is adept at using large data sets to build Operations Research models to find opportunities for service delivery and process optimization, as well as to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Employs a variety of modeling and data analysis techniques, and utilizes knowledge of the operations and care delivery to build realistic models. The Data Scientist drives business results with evidence-based insights and works with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The Data Scientist discovers solutions hidden in large data sets and works with stakeholders to improve business processes and outcomes.

Individually we are people, but together we are Aviva. Individually these are just words, but together they are our Values – Care, Commitment, Community, and Confidence.
If you’re ready to return to work after a career break and actively looking for your next challenge, then the Aviva Canada Returner Program could be the answer. The Aviva Canada Returner Program is for those who’ve had an extended career break of one or more years. This is a tailored six-month program starting in January 2023, potentially transitioning to a permanent role for those keen to restart their career.
Roles will be based across Aviva’s key locations in Ontario: Markham, Oakville, and Downtown Toronto.
Aviva flexes hours and working patterns to suit its customers, business, and you. Most people are working in a hybrid fashion – spending some of their time in the offices and some at home.

Position Title: Data Scientist
Position Type: Regular - Full-Time
Position Location: Florenceville GTC
Grade: Grade 04
Requisition ID: 18048

We know the importance that food plays in people's lives – the power it has to bring people, families and communities together. Our purpose is to bring enjoyment to people’s lives through great tasting food, in a way which reflects our values.


Earth Observation at McCain operates as a new, independent start-up division under McCain Foods Limited. Through the use of satellite and other remote sensing technologies, the business unit delivers crop insights to McCain agriculture, farmers, and other non-competitive crop buyers to improve decision-making on crop production and agricultural practices under climate volatility.

Introduction
As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

IBM's state-of-the-art Client Innovation Centre (CIC) opened in Nova Scotia in March 2013 and is the first of its kind in Canada. The Centre weaves together IBM’s business insights and industry-leading software portfolio and is ideally suited for any client that needs flexible access to emerging or niche skills that may not be cost effective to grow internally. In addition, our focus on our team is unparalleled as demonstrated by the following:

We are looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.
Responsibilities
Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms

Company Description

You will join a world-class team of engineers and data scientists from Facebook, Uber, Amazon and Google. We are a fast growing consulting firm based in Toronto with clients ranging from leading startups building impactful technologies to Fortune 500 companies looking to scale their engineering and data capabilities.

Job Description

We are looking for Data Scientists who are passionate about Machine Learning, and have deep knowledge in Statistics and Computer Science. You enjoy doing data science projects with structured and/or unstructured data and are motivated to productize scalable machine learning models. We will also rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for this role.

At Drax we are working towards a zero-carbon, sustainable future and you can help make this future a reality.
If you are a strong communicator who is strategic, technical and who values quality, then the Data Scientist position maybe your next best move.

So, what will you be doing?

You will further the knowledge base of Drax Group with exploratory and iterative data science programmes.

At Desjardins, we believe in equity, diversity and inclusion. We're committed to welcoming, respecting and valuing people for who they are as individuals, learning from their differences, embracing their uniqueness, and providing a positive workplace for all. At Desjardins, we have zero tolerance for discrimination of any kind. We believe our teams should reflect the diversity of the members, clients and communities we serve.
If there's something we can do to help make the recruitment process or the job you're applying for more accessible, let us know. We can provide accommodations at any stage in the recruitment process. Just ask!
Being a data scientist at Desjardins means having the drive to develop a passion for data models, machine learning concepts and quantitative fields (mathematics, finance, actuarial science, statistics, etc.).
We develop and train a wide variety of predictive and prescriptive models so we can do what's best for our members and clients.
Thanks to the models developed to measure the impact of interest rates and inflation, and even various analyses like spatial analyses, we can measure the natural disaster risks that our members and clients could face. Other initiatives focus on risk quantification and customer loyalty models.
The data scientist teams at Desjardins play a strategic role in the organization.

Job Title: Data Scientist | Cleantech SAAS Platform | Remote Working
Job Description:
$90,000 - $110,000 + Equity
Work for a company that's making a difference for the environment
Remote working

The Company:

This exciting start-up is an innovative cleantech company, bringing energy reducing technology solutions to consumers, trade, utilities, and government to help create a more sustainable future. They are building a dynamic enterprise software-as-a-service platform and are looking for people with a passion, curiosity, and purpose for using their skills and creativity to make the world a better place. They are a provider of data services, applications and intelligence to governments and utilities in the areas of energy efficiency and renewable energy. They’ve developed a data framework that provides continuous data optimization of energy efficiency data using proprietary algorithms that power white-label applications and or hosted services for energy efficiency programs. Their applications include an opportunity map for energy intensity, digital building audit tools, engagement tools and an online marketplace.




We are looking for a data scientist that will help discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help this company make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, understanding GIS and geo-spatial mapping and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products. Specifically, you will automate their building energy scoring using machine learning techniques, build recommendation systems, and further develop their catalog of products for energy efficiency and renewable building improvements.
The ideal candidate will have a passion for putting analytical data skills towards solving complex problems with a focus on geo-spatial techniques, working well with teams, and fighting hard to meet deadlines and build break-out products.




If you’re looking for an opportunity to join a cutting-edge start-up, working on some of the most exciting applications and technology in the business, don’t hesitate in putting forward an application! To automatically receive notifications upon new roles and market updates, follow our LinkedIn page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/white-bay-search/

Job Description:
Data Scientist

Apex Systems is a global IT services provider, and our staffing group has an opening for an Data Scientist to place at our client, an Enterprise Retail Company.

Client: Enterprise Retail Company

Start date: ASAP

Terms: 6-month contract to start – possibility of extension/conversion

40 hours p/week

Currently Remote; office in North York for purposeful meetings

Please submit your resume via the platform you are using. If you encounter any issues, please email your resume to Rohan at rkapur@apexsystems.com and reference Data Scientist.

Job Description

Data Scientist

We are seeking world-class talent looking to build a career with the world’s largest improvement retailer, operating more than 2,200 store locations in the U.S, Canada and Mexico. Specifically, your role in our clients will place you at the center of one of the top retailers in Canada that is experiencing an exciting growth trajectory.

You will work with IT teams and business partners to understand strategic initiatives as well as support the delivery of leading-edge capabilities that support our clients retail business.

The Data Scientist will be responsible for partnering with key business stakeholders and leveraging internal clients and industry data to develop predictive algorithms and models. The primary focus of the Sr. Data scientist will be to identify trends in data to glean meaningful business insights and drive cross-functional business solutions via statistical data analysis, and advanced analytics techniques in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML). The individual will also work closely with other IT Product teams and support the various stages of the analytics development lifecycle. A successful candidate will be passionate about seeing real-world impact of advanced analytics and have a solid understanding of scientific and business needs, as well as the areas of data science, AI and ML that can be transformative and impactful to the retail industry.


Leverage strong communication skills and business acumen to work closely with cross-functional business owners to drive data and analytics technologies for business use.
To design, develop and implement predictive/analytical algorithms and statistical data modeling tools to derive insights for complex business operations and processes.
Be a subject matter expert in supervised and unsupervised ML algorithms and other applied AI techniques to derive meaningful and actionable insights from big data.
Implement scalable, efficient processes for large scale data analyses, model development and deployment.
Be responsible for effectively communicating insights, findings, test results, performance analysis to both functional teams, and the senior management along with recommendations for enhancements/improvements.
Continually drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. Constantly upskill and remain fully updated with the evolving data and analytics community.
Provides technical advice, support and guidance to junior data scientists and ML engineers on navigating ML/AI modeling work for real-world business problems on a case-by-case basis.


Master’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or Mathematics (or Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science, Math or related quantitative field).
4 to 6 years of experience in data science, data mining, analysis, and visualization with the ability to identify and present actionable insights from data to address business problems (preferably in the retail sector).
Have a good understanding of data analysis, advanced analytics with exposure to AI/ML and technologies within the cloud environment.
Demonstrated experience in using statistical and data manipulation languages (e.g. Python, R, SQL) and familiarity with Confluence, and JIRA.
Strong communication, presentation and documentation skills is also required.

What do we offer?

An opportunity to gain real-world experience in supporting data science and analytics initiatives within a large retail organization.
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional growth and development.
A unique and competitive team, an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages thinking “outside-the-box”, being inquisitive to learning, and sharing success.
An attractive compensation and benefits package.

Job Title: Data Scientist - Data Operations and Analytics
Job Description:
Location: Toronto, ON, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Calgary, AB, CA Edmonton, AB, CA
Req ID: 28845
Jobs by Category: Technology Solutions
Job Function: Planning and Analysis
Status: Full Time
Schedule: Regular
Let the data do the talking! If you love a challenge and love Data, this role is for you.

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

The Data Operations and Analytics team is an internally focused reporting and analytics product minded team within TELUS, responsible for reporting on key operational metrics to ensure we are delivering to our customers. We discover key insights into our outages and provide the day to day on our ability to deliver. The Reliability Center of Excellence mission is to aim for the highest degree of service reliability for our customers – and for our team. We are dedicated to support all aspects of improving reliability here within TELUS operations. Our team includes a passionate group of business analysts, network analysts, data analysts, data scientists and data engineers.

Job Title: Data Science Intern for fast-growing startup
Job Description:
Company description
10Adventures is a fast-growing tech company focused on Adventure Travel. Our Adventure Travel Ecosystem lets outdoor lovers plan their next adventure - whether they want to use our free, guidebook quality info to plan their trip or book a tour on a marketplace that connects them to local tour operators in over 75 countries.
Job description
The Data Scientist Intern role will be focused on solving real world business challenges for a fast-growing tech company. The main goal will be to use data to optimize our business performance, with a particular emphasis on advanced analytics to improve user experience and drive increased sales.
The successful candidate will rely on a strong background and love for predictive modeling, forecasting, statistics, and optimization. They will use these skills to deliver solutions and recommendations that the business can rely on for decisions that could have multi-million dollar impacts.

Level AI is a Mountain View, CA-based startup innovating in the Voice AI space. We are backed by top VCs, technologists from Silicon Valley and industry experts. We are on a mission to revolutionize the customer sales experience for businesses. We are innovating in speech AI, NLP and information retrieval systems to bring customers and businesses closer to one another. As one of the critical members of the Level team your work will be new and of the highest impact to shape the future of AI in businesses. You will directly work with a team of experienced technologists to identify and solve a new set of problems. The team has experience from Amazon Alexa, Google, and other leading AI organizations. You will have the freedom to pave a new path to achieve our mission.
Responsibilities
Big picture: Understand customers’ needs and innovate and use cutting edge Machine Learning techniques to build data-driven solutions.
Work on NLP problems across areas such as text classification, entity extraction, summarization and others.

Do you want to help local businesses grow? Our Ad Targeting team connects millions of users to the right businesses each day. From restaurants, boutiques, and salons, to dentists, mechanics, and plumbers, our recommendation system knows just the place.

As an Applied Scientist, you will design robust A/B experiments to characterize user behavior, assess machine learning models through careful statistical analysis, and build end-to-end machine learning models that help millions of users make better decisions.

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we’re a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages creative solutions to problems. We enable all new team members to deploy working code in their first week, and your impact will only grow from there with the support of your manager, mentor, and team. Learn more about Yelp by visiting: Culture at Yelp / Yelp Fact Sheet / Diversity at Yelp / Yelp Engineering Blog / Yelp Blog / Yelp Open Source / Yelp Economic Average.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Job Title: Data Scientist, Data, Analytics, Evaluation and Reporting (DARE)
Job Description:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.

In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA. As such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.

Reporting to a Director, Data Analytics Reporting and Evaluation (DARE), the Data Scientist develops, operationalizes and improves analytical models to support and inform operational, tactical and strategic decision making at PHSA. The Data Scientist is adept at using large data sets to build Operations Research models to find opportunities for service delivery and process optimization, as well as to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Employs a variety of modeling and data analysis techniques, and utilizes knowledge of the operations and care delivery to build realistic models. The Data Scientist drives business results with evidence-based insights and works with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The Data Scientist discovers solutions hidden in large data sets and works with stakeholders to improve business processes and outcomes.

Job Title: Aviva Canada Returner Program – Data Science
Job Description:
Aviva Canada Returners Program – Data Science
Location: Ontario, Canada (Markham/Toronto/Oakville)
Opportunity: 6-month returnship, with online Launch Event
Start Date: January 2023
Apply by: 31 October 2022 for Program, register by 12 October for Launch Event
Individually we are people, but together we are Aviva. Individually these are just words, but together they are our Values – Care, Commitment, Community, and Confidence.
If you’re ready to return to work after a career break and actively looking for your next challenge, then the Aviva Canada Returner Program could be the answer. The Aviva Canada Returner Program is for those who’ve had an extended career break of one or more years. This is a tailored six-month program starting in January 2023, potentially transitioning to a permanent role for those keen to restart their career.
Roles will be based across Aviva’s key locations in Ontario: Markham, Oakville, and Downtown Toronto.
Aviva flexes hours and working patterns to suit its customers, business, and you. Most people are working in a hybrid fashion – spending some of their time in the offices and some at home.

Position Title: Data Scientist
Position Type: Regular - Full-Time
Position Location: Florenceville GTC
Grade: Grade 04
Requisition ID: 18048

We know the importance that food plays in people's lives – the power it has to bring people, families and communities together. Our purpose is to bring enjoyment to people’s lives through great tasting food, in a way which reflects our values.


Earth Observation at McCain operates as a new, independent start-up division under McCain Foods Limited. Through the use of satellite and other remote sensing technologies, the business unit delivers crop insights to McCain agriculture, farmers, and other non-competitive crop buyers to improve decision-making on crop production and agricultural practices under climate volatility.

Introduction
As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities

IBM's state-of-the-art Client Innovation Centre (CIC) opened in Nova Scotia in March 2013 and is the first of its kind in Canada. The Centre weaves together IBM’s business insights and industry-leading software portfolio and is ideally suited for any client that needs flexible access to emerging or niche skills that may not be cost effective to grow internally. In addition, our focus on our team is unparalleled as demonstrated by the following:

We are looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.
Responsibilities
Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms

Company Description

You will join a world-class team of engineers and data scientists from Facebook, Uber, Amazon and Google. We are a fast growing consulting firm based in Toronto with clients ranging from leading startups building impactful technologies to Fortune 500 companies looking to scale their engineering and data capabilities.

Job Description

We are looking for Data Scientists who are passionate about Machine Learning, and have deep knowledge in Statistics and Computer Science. You enjoy doing data science projects with structured and/or unstructured data and are motivated to productize scalable machine learning models. We will also rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for this role.

We are looking for Data Scientists who are passionate about analytics and using data to help drive business decisions. At Drax we are working towards a zero-carbon, sustainable future and you can help make this future a reality.
If you are a strong communicator who is strategic, technical and who values quality, then the Data Scientist position maybe your next best move.

So, what will you be doing?

You will further the knowledge base of Drax Group with exploratory and iterative data science programmes.

At Desjardins, we believe in equity, diversity and inclusion. We're committed to welcoming, respecting and valuing people for who they are as individuals, learning from their differences, embracing their uniqueness, and providing a positive workplace for all. At Desjardins, we have zero tolerance for discrimination of any kind. We believe our teams should reflect the diversity of the members, clients and communities we serve.
If there's something we can do to help make the recruitment process or the job you're applying for more accessible, let us know. We can provide accommodations at any stage in the recruitment process. Just ask!
Being a data scientist at Desjardins means having the drive to develop a passion for data models, machine learning concepts and quantitative fields (mathematics, finance, actuarial science, statistics, etc.).
We develop and train a wide variety of predictive and prescriptive models so we can do what's best for our members and clients.
Thanks to the models developed to measure the impact of interest rates and inflation, and even various analyses like spatial analyses, we can measure the natural disaster risks that our members and clients could face. Other initiatives focus on risk quantification and customer loyalty models.
The data scientist teams at Desjardins play a strategic role in the organization.
